intro: Psychotria mayana, commonly known as the Mayan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and parts of the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. Psychotria mayana is also known for its use in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
